Sentencas: Perovskites on the basis of LaCrO3 are of interest as ceramic interconnect materials for the development of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: The interconnects are exposed to oxidising and reducing atmospheres under operating conditions.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: Oxygen vacancy formation was determined as a function of oxygen partial pressure between I and 10(-22)
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: bar at temperatures between 900 and 1100 degreesC. Different perovskite compositions made of (La,Ca/Sr)CrO3-delta, La(Cr,Mg)O3-delta, La(Cr,Mg/Cu/Co,Al)O3-delta, and (La,Ca)(Cr,Al)O3- were investigated.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: Defect models were evaluated to describe the oxygen vacancy formation and the respective thermodynamic data were determined.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: The results are used to explain existing literature data on the isothermal expansion of LaCrO3 based perovskites under reducing conditions.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: Complementary mechanical measurements with selected perovskite compositions revealed that lower oxygen partial pressure causes higher stiffness, strength and fracture toughness.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)

Sentencas: The change in properties is discussed in terms of the observed ferroelastic domains and the interaction of the domain wall motion with the oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Defect formation and mechanical stability of perovskites based on LaCrO3 for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC)
